extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound brussels sprouts, each one trimmed at the root end and cut in half lengthwise
extendedIngredients.originalName: brussels sprouts, each one trimmed at the root end and cut in half lengthwise

extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme leaves

title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
summary: Roasted Brussels Sprouts is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish. One serving contains 20 calories, 2g of protein, and 0g of fat. For 54 cents per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 10. It will be a hit at your Christmas event. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of lemon-infused olive oil, champagne vinegar, ground pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is super. Try Kittencal's Roasted Brussels/Brussels Sprouts, Cheesy Fried Polenta w/Pan Roasted Balsamic Brussels Sprouts + Roasted Garlic Sage Oil, and Roasted Brussels Sprouts for similar recipes.
instructions: Prepare the grill for direct cooking over low heat (250 to 350F) and preheat the grill pan.                                                                                                 In a medium bowl mix the marinade ingredients. Add the brussels sprouts and turn to coat them evenly.                                                                                                 Spread the brussels sprouts in a single layer on the grill pan and grill over direct low heat, with the lid closed as much as possible, until crisp-tender, 10 to 15 minutes, turning several times. Transfer to a serving bowl and add the lemon zest and vinegar. Toss to coat evenly. Season with salt, if desired. Serve warm.

steps.step: Prepare the grill for direct cooking over low heat (250 to 350F) and preheat the grill pan.
In a medium bowl mix the marinade ingredients.
Add the brussels sprouts and turn to coat them evenly.
Spread the brussels sprouts in a single layer on the grill pan and grill over direct low heat, with the lid closed as much as possible, until crisp-tender, 10 to 15 minutes, turning several times.
Transfer to a serving bowl and add the lemon zest and vinegar. Toss to coat evenly. Season with salt, if desired.
